verses.t: When I would have healed{H7495} Israel{H3478}, then the iniquity{H5771} of Ephraim{H669} was discovered{H1540}, and the wickedness{H7451} of Samaria{H8111}: for they commit{H6466} falsehood{H8267}; and the thief{H1590} cometh in{H935}, and the troop{H1416} of robbers spoileth{H6584} without{H2351}.wickedness: Heb. evilsspoileth: Heb. strippeth

And they consider{H559} not in their hearts{H3824} that I remember{H2142} all their wickedness{H7451}: now their own doings{H4611} have beset them about{H5437}; they are before my face{H6440}.consider…: Heb. say not to
They make the king{H4428} glad{H8055} with their wickedness{H7451}, and the princes{H8269} with their lies{H3585}.

are all adulterers{H5003}, as an oven{H8574} heated{H1197} by the baker{H644}, who ceaseth{H7673} from raising{H5782} after he hath kneaded{H3888} the dough{H1217}, until it be leavened{H2556}.who…: or, the raiser will ceaseraising: or, waking

In the day{H3117} of our king{H4428} the princes{H8269} have made him sick{H2470} with bottles{H2534} of wine{H3196}; he stretched out{H4900} his hand{H3027} with scorners{H3945}.bottles…: or, heat through wine

For they have made ready{H7126} their heart{H3820} like an oven{H8574}, whiles they lie in wait{H693}: their baker{H644} sleepeth{H3463} all the night{H3915}; in the morning{H1242} it burneth{H1197} as a flaming{H3852} fire{H784}.made…: or, applied
They are all hot{H2552} as an oven{H8574}, and have devoured{H398} their judges{H8199}; all their kings{H4428} are fallen{H5307}: there is none among them that calleth{H7121} unto me.
Ephraim{H669}, he hath mixed{H1101} himself among the people{H5971}; Ephraim{H669} is a cake{H5692} not turned{H2015}.
Strangers{H2114} have devoured{H398} his strength{H3581}, and he knoweth{H3045} it not: yea, gray hairs{H7872} are here and there{H2236} upon him, yet he knoweth{H3045} not.here…: Heb. sprinkled
And the pride{H1347} of Israel{H3478} testifieth{H6030} to his face{H6440}: and they do not return{H7725} Lordto the {H3068} their God{H430}, nor seek{H1245} him for all this.
Ephraim{H669} also is like a silly{H6601} dove{H3123} without heart{H3820}: they call{H7121} to Egypt{H4714}, they go{H1980} to Assyria{H804}.

When they shall go{H3212}, I will spread{H6566} my net{H7568} upon them; I will bring them down{H3381} as the fowls{H5775} of the heaven{H8064}; I will chastise{H3256} them, as their congregation{H5712} hath heard{H8088}.

Woe{H188} unto them! for they have fled{H5074} from me: destruction{H7701} unto them! because they have transgressed{H6586} against me: though I have redeemed{H6299} them, yet they have spoken{H1696} lies{H3577} against me.destruction: Heb. spoil

And they have not cried{H2199} unto me with their heart{H3820}, when they howled{H3213} upon their beds{H4904}: they assemble{H1481} themselves for corn{H1715} and wine{H8492}, and they rebel{H5493} against me.
Though I have bound{H3256} and strengthened{H2388} their arms{H2220}, yet do they imagine{H2803} mischief{H7451} against me.have…: or, chastened

They return{H7725}, but not to the most High{H5920}: they are like a deceitful{H7423} bow{H7198}: their princes{H8269} shall fall{H5307} by the sword{H2719} for the rage{H2195} of their tongue{H3956}: this{H2097} shall be their derision{H3933} in the land{H776} of Egypt{H4714}.
